page.title: 03Changes in Bookham
page.content: Transport services have been cut; there are fewer busses and trains, and the station is often unmanned. Private housing is built on every available plot, but the village is increasingly untidy with no regular road-sweeper, poor road maintenance and serious parking difficulties. Vandalism has become a problem; especially at risk are the churchyards bus_shelters and telephone boxes. All this reflects the increasing urbanisation of the area - more private houses on smaller plots, more shops including 2 supermarkets, and more service functions. There are even a few small offices beside specialist shops selling gifts, luxury furniture and jewelry. Not all these ventures have been successful - some have closed, perhaps because of the recent economic recession.
